How to Install homebank on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • homebank

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install homebank on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing homebank on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall homebank in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install homebank, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install homebank Using apt

To install homebank in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install homebank using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install homebank

The installation of homebank might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install homebank Using apt-get

To install homebank using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install homebank.

sudo apt-get -y install homebank

Install homebank Using Synaptic

To install homebank using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install homebank on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for homebank. This will display the homebank package in the package window, now to install homebank, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the homebank package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of homebank.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install homebank Using aptitude

To install homebank on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of homebank.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install homebank using the command aptitude install homebank.

sudo aptitude -y install homebank

How to Upgrade homebank on debian

If you want to upgrade the homebank package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade homebank using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade homebank to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade homebank.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade homebank sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade homebank

Upgrade homebank using Aptitude

To upgrade homebank using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade homebank.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade homebank

Upgrade homebank using Synaptic

To upgrade homebank using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for homebank, now right-click homebank, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade homebank just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall homebank on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall homebank from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just homebank, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove homebank

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of homebank

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of homebank you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge homebank

Remove homebank using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall homebank using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for homebank, right-click the homebank package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall homebank click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install homebank on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade homebank using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of homebank then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
